function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate filtration of toluene and formaldehyde due to low bed water content","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate contaminant concentration measurements at the inlet and outlet of the air cleaner","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Slow decay of emission rate of formaldehyde and toluene","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Effect of filter bed on air temperature and rh","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Maximum clean air provided by the dbaf","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of specific chemicals such as formaldehyde and acetaldehyde in the testing process can pose health risks to individuals.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Quasi-steady state assumption may lead to inaccurate estimation of emission rates, causing potential misinterpretation of data.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting the sink effect term in the mass balance equation may result in underestimation of contaminant levels, leading to inadequate mitigation measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low pollutant concentration due to low emitting materials used","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of toluene as the target voc for study","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of single pass efficiency until october 2009","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contaminant concentration inside the chamber","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Chamber leakage rate","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Integration of botanical air filtration system into the hvac system","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No clean air supplied to the chamber","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Chamber leakage effect","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Surface adsorption effect","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High air change rate and complete air mixing may lead to rapid spread of contagious diseases if present in the chamber","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Injection of vocs volatile organic compounds like formaldehyde and toluene into the chamber for testing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variation in filter bed moisture content levels during tests may impact the efficiency of vocs removal and air quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for microbial growth in the root bed due to the presence of microorganisms and organic compounds","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate moisture control leading to the growth of mold and bacteria in the root bed","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient airflow and ventilation leading to poor air quality and accumulation of vocs in the indoor environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of polluted air into the plant root system","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long-term performance of the botanical air filtration system","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Insufficient data on the effectiveness of botanical air filtration under realistic ventilation conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overestimation of indoor plant air purification capabilities based on chamber studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential microbial growth related to vocs becoming a carbon source for soil microbial communities in plant rhizosphere","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High indoor air pollution levels compared to outdoor levels","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate methods for volatile organic compounds vocs removal from indoor air","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of indoor air quality improvement methods","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation of not measuring viral aerosol particle size directly.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral clumping and associations with suspended proteins may cause variability in viral particle size.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adenovirus is the most resistant to 254 nm uv-c and requires high uv doses for complete inactivation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data on uv inactivation of viral aerosols","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Assumption of linear relationship between uv dose and percent survival","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Effect of nebulization and liquid impingement on the survival of animal viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of aerosol dryer to ensure uniformity of particles","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effect of relative humidity on uv effectiveness against bacteria and viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent impact of rh on bioaerosol particle size","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consensus on the impact of rh on bioaerosol particle size","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of viruses due to aerosolization and sampling","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of relative humidity on uv susceptibility of viral aerosols","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viral aerosols exhibit higher uv susceptibility at higher rh.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses like mhv coronavirus are susceptible to inactivation by mechanical stress.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aerosolization and sampling can lead to survival of infectious viruses, increasing the risk of disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in survival rates of viruses in different suspension media can impact disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uv susceptibility of viral aerosols varies with different viruses and rh levels, affecting the effectiveness of uv-c disinfection","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uv radiation mapping shows variability in uv exposure levels across the chamber.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Testing the effects of nebulization on the survival of viruses.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
